enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To establish the Law School Clinic Certification Program of the United States Patent and Trademark Office, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

header.#text: USPTO Law School Clinic Certification Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Law School Clinic Certification Program of the United States Patent and Trademark Office

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is established as a program entitled the
shall allow students enrolled in a participating law school’s clinic to practice patent and trademark law before the
by drafting, filing, and prosecuting patent or trademark applications, or both, on a pro-bono basis for clients that qualify for assistance from the law school’s clinic. The
shall establish regulations and procedures for application to and participation in the
. All law schools accredited by the American Bar Association are eligible for participation in the Program, and shall be examined for acceptance using identical criteria established by the
. The Program shall be in effect for the 10-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.
shall, not later than the last day of the 2-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , describing the number of law schools and law students participating in the Program, the work done through the Program, the benefits of the Program, and any recommendations of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Patent and Trademark Office

quote.#tail: means the Law School Clinic Certification Program established in subsection (a).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: HR 5108 ENR: To establish the Law School Clinic Certification Program of the United States Patent and Trademark Office, and for other purposes.
